title: Font Squirrel
description: "100% free fonts for commercial use."

title: Unsplash
description: "The internet’s source of freely useable images. Powered by creators everywhere."

title: Free Software Foundation
description: "A nonprofit with a worldwide mission to promote computer user freedom."

title: OpenBSD
description: "A freely available, multi-platform 4.4BSD-based UNIX-like operating system."

title: Alpine Linux
description: "Small. Simple. Secure." A lightweight Linux distribution.

title: Arch Linux
description: "A lightweightand flexible Linux distribution that tries to Keep It Simple."

title: Debian
description: "The universal operating system."

title: Fedora
description: "An innovative, free, and open source platform for hardware, clouds, and containers that enables software developers and community members to build tailored solutions for their users."

title: Frugal
description: "Frugalware is a general purpose linux distribution, designed for intermediate users (who are not afraid of text mode)."

title: Gentoo
description: "A highly flexible, source-based distribution."

title: Kali
description: "An open source project that is maintained and funded by Offensive Security, a provider of world-class information security training and penetration testing services."

title: OpenSUSE
description: "The makers' choice for sysadmins, developers and desktop users."

title: Raspberry Pi
description: "A series of small single-board computers developed in the United Kingdom by the Raspberry Pi Foundation to promote the teaching of basic computer science in schools and in developing countries."

title: Raspbian
description: "A free operating system based on Debian optimized for the Raspberry Pi hardware"

title: xbian
description: "A small, fast and lightweight media center distribution based on Debian."

title: RetroPie
description: "Allows you to turn your Raspberry Pi, Odroid C1/C2, or PC into a retro-gaming machine. Built upon Raspbian, Emulation Station, RetroArch, and more."

title: Remarkable
description: "A fully featured markdown editor for Linux and Windows."

title: Simple Markdown Editor
description: "A simple, embeddablem and beautiful JavaScript markdown editor."

title: Visual Studio Code
description: "A source code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS with support for debugging, embedded Git control, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring. It is free and open-source, although the official download is under a proprietary license."

title: VSCodium
description: "A community-driven, freely-licensed (MIT), binary distribution of Microsoft’s VSCode with Telemetry/Tracking disabled."

title: Bitbucket
description: "A web-based version control repository hosting service owned by Atlassian, for source code and development projects that use either Mercurial or Git revision control systems."

title: Github
description: "A web-based hosting service for version control using Git."

title: Gitlab
description: "A web-based Git-repository manager with wiki and issue-tracking features, using an open-source license."

title: Angular
description: "A JavaScript-based open-source front-end web application framework mainly maintained by Google and by a community of individuals and corporations to address many of the challenges encountered in developing single-page applications."

title: Chai
description: "A BDD / TDD assertion library for node and the browser that can be delightfully paired with any javascript testing framework."

title: Electron
description: "A framework for creating native applications with web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS."

title: Express
description: "A web application framework for Node.js, released as free and open-source software under the MIT License, for building web applications and APIs."

title: Greensock
description: "Ultra high-performance, professional-grade animation for the modern web."

title: Grunt
description: "A JavaScript task runner, a tool used to automatically perform frequent tasks such as minification, compilation, unit testing, and linting."

title: Gulp
description: "An open-source JavaScript toolkit by Fractal Innovations and the open source community at GitHub, used as a streaming build system in front-end web development."

title: Ionic
description: "A complete open-source SDK for hybrid mobile app development."

title: Jekyll
description: "A simple, blog-aware, static site generator for personal, project, or organization sites."

title: Mocha
description: "A JavaScript test framework for Node.js programs, featuring browser support, asynchronous testing, test coverage reports, and use of any assertion library."

title: Phaser
description: "A fast, free, and fun open source framework for Canvas and WebGL powered browser games."

title: Protractor
description: "An end-to-end test framework for Angular and AngularJS applications, running tests against your application running in a real browser, interacting with it as a user would."

title: React
description: "A JavaScript library for building user interfaces."

title: Sass
description: "A CSS pre-processor with syntax advancements that outputs regular CSS style sheets."

title: Typescript
description: "A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript."

title: Webpack
description: "A static module bundler for modern JavaScript applications."

title: Docker
description: "Fast and secure platform for high-velocity innovation."

title: qemu
description: "A free and open-source hosted hypervisor that performs hardware virtualization."

title: VirtualBox
description: "A free and open-source hypervisor for x86 computers currently being developed by Oracle Corporation."

title: VMWare
description: "A subsidiary of Dell Technologies that provides cloud computing and platform virtualization software and services."
